item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Paranoid? Probably. But just because you're paranoid doesn't mean there isn't an invisible demon about to eat your face." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Life is a journey. Time is a river. The door is ajar" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Of course Evil's afoot. If it had switched to the metric system it'd be up to a meter by now. " -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "An <i>errand</i> is getting a tank of gas or picking up a carton of milk or something. It is <i>not</i> getting chased by flying purple pyromaniac gorillas hurling incendiary poo!" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "You backbiting, poisonous, treacherous, deceitful, wicked, <i>clever</i> girl. If this works I'll buy you a pony." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "In the name of the Pizza Lord. Charge!" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
Lisa add a quote by jim butcher
item.description: "I died. I died and someone made a clerical error and I am in Heaven." -- jim butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "If I need you I'll give you a signal.' 'What signal?' 'I'll imitate the scream of a terrified little girl" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Don't mess with a wizard when he's wizarding!" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Polka will never die." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "What is the point of having free will if one cannot occasionally spit in the eye of destiny?" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Nay, but prithee, with sprinkles 'pon it instead," I said solemnly, "and frosting of white." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "I'd made the vampire cry. Great. I felt like a real superhero. Harry Dresden, breaker of monsters' hearts." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Likest thou jelly within thy doughnut?" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "A technicality I'm prepared to hide wildly behind." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "You rush a miracle worker, you get lousy miracles!" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Put some clothes on, you weird, yellow-eyed, table-dancing, werewolf-training, cryptic, stare-me-right-in-the-eyes-and-don't-even-blink wench." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "In the action business, when you don't want to say you ran like a mouse, you call it 'taking cover.' It's more heroic." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description:
"Ack!" I said.
Fearless master of the witty dialogue, that's me." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "A succubus on the set. Strike that, the health-conscious kid sister made it two… succubuses. Succubusees? Succubi? Stupid Latin correspondence course." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "I let out a battle cry. Sure, a lot of people might have mistaken it for a sudden yelp of unmanly fear, but trust me. It was a battle cry." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Kincaid! Bolshevik Muppet!" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "Don't call me a dinosaur. It isn't fair to the dinosaurs. What did a dinosaur ever do to you?" -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description:
"She frowned at me. "You need some rest. You look like hell. And you're obviously tired enough to have gotten the giggles."
Wizards don't giggle," I said, hardly able to speak. "This is cackling." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "I parked in front of the Field Museum under a NO PARKING sign. There were a couple of actual spots I could have used, but the drive was even closer. Besides, I found it aesthetically satisfying to defy municipal code." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "And thrice do I say to thee...bite me." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "If your opponent has you by fifty pounds, winning a fight against him is a dubious proposition, at best. If your opponent has you by eight thousand and fifty pounds, you’ve left the realm of combat and enrolled yourself in Road-kill 101. Or possibly in a Tom and Jerry cartoon." -- Jim Butcher

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description:
"Murphy hung up and I said, to the still-open line, "Hey, if you've got someone watching my place, could you call the cops if anyone tries to steal my Star Wars poster? It's an original."
Then I vindictively hung up on the FBI. It made my inner child happy." -- Jim Butcher
